intro: Cyrtandra divertae, commonly known as the Kona Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and is often found in the Kona District of the Big Island. Cyrtandra divertae is a herbaceous perennial with lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
